meaningMnemonic: Remember how  手 can sometimes mean “doer”? What do you think a <kanji>song</kanji> <kanji>doer</kanji> is? A <vocabulary>singer</vocabulary>, of course
readingMnemonic: The readings are on'yomi readings. You've learned them both already (you learned 手's on'yomi reading with word 投手), so you should be able to read this like a <vocabulary>singer</vocabulary> sings with a bunch of <reading>cashew</reading>s かしゅ in their mouth. FAST AND LOUD!
